<title
    level="1"
    right="Item 6"
    pfs="Standard"
>
[Storyteller's Opus](/Equipment.aspx?ID=995)
</title>

<traits>
<trait label="Grimoire" url="/Traits.aspx?ID=387" />
<trait label="Illusion" url="/Traits.aspx?ID=92" />
<trait label="Magical" url="/Traits.aspx?ID=103" />
</traits>

<column gap="tiny">

**Source** [Secrets of Magic](/Sources.aspx?ID=96) pg. 163 <sup>2.0</sup>

**Price** 230 gp

<row gap="medium">

**Bulk** L
</row>

<row gap="medium">

 

 

 
</row>

</column>

---

This green spellbook with gold trim contains a cautionary story about a boy who was eaten by a wolf after he previously lied about wolf attacks. When opened, the engravings on the front seem to move in a loop, enacting this story.

**Activate** <actions string="Reaction" /> envision;  **Frequency** once per day; **Trigger** A creature succeeds, but doesn't critically succeed, at a Perception check to disbelieve an [illusion](/Traits.aspx?ID=92) spell you prepared from this grimoire;  **Effect** You quickly tell a fib to try to smooth over the inconsistencies in your illusion. Attempt a [Deception](/Skills.aspx?ID=5) check against the triggering creature's Perception DC. If you succeed, the creature doesn't disbelieve the illusion.

<column gap="tiny">

</column>
